bill_title: establish qualifications for child custody evaluators.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to establish qualifications for child custody evaluators. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 25-4A-23 be AMENDED: 25-4A-23. Home study or custody evaluation--Mediation. Prior to ruling on a joint physical custody petition the court may require the parties to participate in a home study or a custody evaluation. Prior to ruling on a joint physical custody petition, the court may require the parties to participate in a custody evaluation conducted by: (1) (a) A board certified psychiatrist; (b) A psychologist licensed in accordance with chapter 36-27A; (c) A marriage and family therapist licensed in accordance with chapter 36-33; or (d) A certified social worker licensed in accordance with chapter 36-26; or (2) In the absence of a person who meets the qualifications set forth in subdivision (1) of this section: (a) A person who by education, training, and experience, meets nationally recognized competencies and standards of practice in child custody evaluation, as determined by the court; or (b) A person stipulated to by both parties and approved by the court. Prior to the court ruling on a joint physical custody petition, either parent may request mediation pursuant to § 25-4-56. In any case where If the court orders the parties to participate in a home study, a custody evaluation, or custody mediation, the court shall allocate the costs of the same between the parties.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
